i think the fact that portal has a lot of anti-human sentiments, and that i thoroughly enjoy it, is really reaffirming in how misanthropic i am.

Epiphany aside, the game is also good.

I 100% recommend this!! It is possibly my favourite game ever, and you can get hours and hours out of it! At first it sounds like a simple story mode game which you can‚Äôt get much out of, but when you play you discover co-op mode, level builder, community tests, and all the amazing mods. I would recommend Portal Stories: Mel and Aperture Tag for mods, as they are 2 amazing things you can add to the game. It is a super cheap and amazing game, and I love it. I hope this review has convinced someone to buy it!

Another ùò§ùò≠ùò¢ùò¥ùò¥ùò™ùò§ game you have to try at least once. Great puzzles that will make you feel like the smartest person on the world, while also maintaining a good storyline with just fantastic characters. I have to say that I think the voice acting is one of the best features of the game, they certainly help make every character be more memorable. Purely because of the voice acting, I can remember what every character's attitude was like despite that it has been ùò∫ùò¶ùò¢ùò≥ùò¥ since I first played! The campaign and story might be a tad short and some maps might look a bit repetitive, but I personally don't think those are a huge con. Everything else about the game gives shines brighter than a couple small faults.
Even after the campaign, you can try out coop or many of the workshop maps! You can continue the magic after the victory from the finale, and there are some ùò≥ùò¶ùò¢ùò≠ùò≠ùò∫ creative maps out there. Invite your friend to play and it'll definitely feel like a smart bonding session you should enjoy.
Overall, I think this is a great game suited for every type of gamer and I definitely enjoyed it.
